p: Further, our results were in accordance with previous findings of some investigators who reported that treatment of 6-gingerol and silymarin had significant hepatoprotective effect against acetaminophen-induced hepatotoxicity as indicated by the decrease in serum levels of liver marker enzymes including AST, ALT, and ALP [ 43]. Besides, another previous study has confirmed the hepatoprotective activity of ginger. An administration of ginger has exhibited the decrease in the elevated serum level of AST, ALT, and ALP [ 44]. In addition, ginger treatment prior to acetaminophen displayed a significant hepatoprotective effect because of the decrease in the concentration of hepatic marker enzymes and total bilirubin in plasma [ 45].
